meanings.sent1: After some employees left, the company is restaffing the department.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to restaff the team with new hires.
meanings.sent3: The office was like a beehive, restaffing after the lunch break.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant kitchen was a battlefield, restaffing its ranks for the dinner rush.
meanings.sent5: The bookstore was a puzzle, restaffing its shelves with new releases.

meanings.definition: The act of replacing or adding staff members.
meanings.sent1: The restaffing of the store brought in fresh faces.
meanings.sent2: Restaffing can improve the efficiency of a workplace.
meanings.sent3: The restaffing process felt like a game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent4: The restaffing of the school faculty was like a jigsaw puzzle coming together.
meanings.sent5: The restaffing of the hospital was a breath of fresh air for the patients.
